I do not have one in my possession. Nor do you, I'm sure. So we require a Dremora to retrieve one for us. You will summon one, and order it to bring a sigil stone to you. I will then inscribe the spells for you.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora. Summoning an Unbound Dremora is not like other Conjuration spells. It will not simply do your bidding. You must first prove you are in control.
I will teach you the spell to summon the Dremora, but know that it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event. Here is the spell you need. Go to the top of the Hall of Attainment; I have prepared a place for you there.

plots: Tammy wants comfort
the player can tame a horse by trying to mount it until it stops throwing the player off its back

quest.title: Moving to Places
quest.objective: bring a horse to Tammy
tasks: Make your way to plains and savannas.
tame a horse
bring a horse to Tammy
quest.description:
*sigh* I dream of leaving this tiny village every day. If only I had a horse... then I could go anywhere I want. Wherever my wanderlust takes me to.
Traveler, you must have covered a lot of land, learned many new skills. Please help me: tame a horse, and bring it to me. Horses are commonly found grazing plains, and their warmer cousins savannas. You can tame a horse by trying to mount it until it stops throwing you off its back. I'll pay a whole block of emeralds for it. Then I too, could take on the life on road.

kbs.name: Habd
kbs.description: a retired sailor, giving quest via "Habd's Journal"

kbs.name: Frostflow Lighthouse
kbs.description: an old lighthouse on an icy coast

kbs.name: Sudi
kbs.description: a woman, Ramati and Habd's daughter

kbs.name: Mani
kbs.description: a man, Ramati and Habd's son

plots: Habd and Ramati sailed for years from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back: Habd and Ramati bought Frostflow Lighthouse to settle down with Mani and Sudi
things went missing from the cellar and strange noises came from there as well

Habd went away from Frostflow Lighthouse to buy some traps: after returning home, he found out that Ramati was killed by a bug-like creature; Habd killed the creature and went into the cellar to save his family, locking the door behind him

quest.title: A Tragedy at Frostflow
quest.objective: uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
tasks: Head to Frostflow Lighthouse.
investigate the cellar
uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
quest.description:
Habd's Journal
by Habd

After years of sailing from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back, Ramati and I have finally saved enough money to buy that old light house we spotted on the coast and we are moving in next month.
These northerners really know how to live. It may be cold, but you can't beat the tranquility of the watching icebergs to live out your silver years. Ramati loves the place too, despite the occasional leaky ceiling. Mani and Sudi, unfortunately, seem miserable here; I know the kids are old enough to strike out on their own, but I hope they'll grow to love the peace and quiet here as I have.
Mani and Sudi continue to bicker and harass each other and they seem to have started in on their mother as well. Ramati keeps finding things missing from the cellar. Sudi said she heard a noise down there but Mani just thinks their mother is going mad from isolation. The very thought of it is ridiculous, she's always wanted to retire here!
Sudi keeps saying that she hears scratching coming from the cellar at night. I think she's just trying to get her mother's goat, but I'd better head into town to get a few traps just in case it's rats. Should only take a couple days. I just hope those two go easy on Ramati while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful Ramati killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor Ramati. It must have come out of the cellar. I'm going down there and locking the door behind me to make sure they don't escape. I don't know if I'll make it out, but I have to save my family!

kbs.name: Vicente Valtieri
kbs.description: the player's superior at the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Languorwine
kbs.description: a rare poison, one drop in bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately

plots: Francois Motierre is waiting for the player inside his house: the player should not kill him
Francois Motierre's debtors have sent an enforcer to kill him
Vicente Valtieri gives the player a knife: the blade has been coated with Languorwine, and there's only enough Languorwine for slicing Francois Motierre
Vicente Valtieri will give the player a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after the player successfully stages his death

quest.title: The Assassinated Man
quest.objective: help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts
tasks: Make your way to Chorrol.
break into Francois Motierre's house
help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts
quest.description:
I, Vicente Valtieri, have a special contract that needs fulfillment. In truth. I don't wish to offer it to any other guild member. I've come to rely on your abilities.
We're usually called upon to take a life, but not this time. This contract requires us to stage the assassination of a marked man.
You must go to the city of Chorrol and break into the house of Francois Motierre. Inside you will find Motierre waiting for you. Do not kill him! You see, Francois Motierre is a marked man. He owes a considerable sum to the wrong kind of people. So, they have sent an enforcer to kill him. This is an unusual contract, Motierre had to make a special arrangement with us before it was approved. I trust in your professionalism.
Here, take this knife. The blade has been coated with a rare poison called Languorwine. One drop in a normal human bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately. I will provide you with a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after you successfully stage his death. You should also know that there's only enough Languorwine on the blade for this one contract. After Motierre is sliced, the knife will be useless.
As payment, I'll be pleased to award you this amulet, Cruelty's Heart.

kbs.name: Hirrus Clutumnus
kbs.description: a man who desperately wants to die

plots: Hirrus Clutumnus is  going to go about his daily life

quest.title: Final Resting
quest.objective: help Hirrus Clutumnus end his life
tasks: kill Hirrus Clutumnus when he is unaware
help Hirrus Clutumnus end his life
quest.description:
Won't someone end me? Take my life, please!
I, Hirrus Clutumnus, am in desperate need of a champion, a hero. Are you brave and fearless? There's a... a simple task. Yes, a simple task that you must perform.
This life, it's... well, it's too painful. Everywhere I look, I see death, dying, and decay. When I dream, I see a world without sunshine. I'm constantly on the verge of retching up, or falling asleep, or screaming at someone who doesn't deserve it. I'm just so fed up with it all.
I need your help. I need you to send my soul away from this world! You must... you must kill me. I don't necessarily want to see it coming. And I want to die here in the city so all these people finally believe me. They'll wish they were nicer. You probably want to do it without spectators though, so you don't get in trouble. Best to make it look like an accident. But remember, I don't want to see it coming. Take me unaware!
I'm going to go about my daily life, such as it is, as if nothing has changed. Make your move when you wish. But, please, do it soon. When you kill me, take the key to my house. Nothing really worth taking, except what's locked up in the jewelry box. You can have that.

kbs.name: Farwil
kbs.description: Count Indarys' son, and a brash young man

plots: Farwil entered the Oblivion Gate with six other Knights of Thorn: Count Indarys posted guards around the Oblivion Gate
Farwil formed the Knights of the Thorn two years ago

quest.title: The Wayward Knight
quest.objective: save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
tasks: enter the Oblivion Gate
save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
quest.description:
About two days ago, Count Indarys's son, Farwil, entered the Oblivion Gate with six other men. We haven't heard from them since then. The Count fears the worst, and has posted guards here so we can watch and see if anyone comes back out. So far, nothing.
At this point, Count Indarys is offering a reward for the recovery of his son from inside the gate... or confirmed news of his demise. If you find him or the rest of the Knights of the Thorn, get them out of there. I'm sure that the Count would also be pleased if the gate was closed.
The Knights of the Thorn are a bunch of rabble who fancy themselves true knights. Farwil formed the group around two years ago. They make grand boasts, and talk a good talk, but that's all they are. The real work goes to us, the City Guard. I hate to speak ill of them, as something horrible may have happened, but their own bravado got them into this mess.

plots: Arkion and Nemphre used to be lovers
Arkion wants Nemphre's Onyx Ring
Nemphre wants Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet

quest.title: Arkion and Nemphre
quest.objective: steal Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring, and bring them to Ordulinian
tasks: find Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring
steal Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring, and bring them to Ordulinian
quest.description:
Ah, fair adventurers, I'm Ordulinian.
The roads of this fair city are lined with fools, are they not? Two of the greatest are Arkion and Nemphre, necromancers grown bitter over lost love. Alas, but they use petty trinkets as their excuse for enmity. Nemphre covets Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Arkion dreams of her Onyx Ring. Steal those trinkets and bring them to me and perhaps those two fools can at last find peace.
For your troubles I will give you a Cloak of Non-Detection. It may be of some use to you in the future.

kbs.name: Renfeld
kbs.description: a man who has been poisoned

quest.title: A Kiss Before Dying
quest.objective: assassinate Ungolim
tasks: Reach Bravil.
eliminate Ungolim when he visits the Lucky Old Lady at night between 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM
assassinate Ungolim
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #7
by Lucien Lachance

My compliments on another job well done! Havilstein Hoar-Blood was more swine than man, and deserved to die quivering like an animal! You must not stop! You must kill again!
Your next target is a Wood Elf named Ungolim, who resides in the city of Bravil. Bravil is also home to an ancient statue known as the Lucky Old Lady. It is seen as a symbol of good luck and prosperity, and the fools of Bravil often speak to the statue and wish for good tidings. Every night, poor lovestruck Ungolim visits the statue and pleads desperately for the heart of a young maiden. This maiden is married, and her husband has learned of Ungolim's affection for his bride. He fears the competition, it would seem, and has commissioned the Dark Brotherhood to help in the matter.
You must go to Bravil, locate Ungolim, and kill him. The Wood Elf owns a house in the city, but he spends his days securely locked inside. I recommend you lie in wait at the Lucky Old Lady statue, and then eliminate Ungolim when he arrives for his nightly visit. He's generally there between the hours of 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
By all accounts, Ungolim is a deadly archer and a fearless opponent. I also have reason to believe he is expecting trouble, so if Ungolim senses danger, he may attack you on sight. Be vigilant, and bring the Wood Elf down! You must not fail!
When Ungolim's body lies broken at the foot of his dear statue, you must journey to the city of Anvil. Your dead drop is in a barrel located behind the statue in the pond. As is standard, your reward and next contract will be waiting.

kbs.name: Gildergreen
kbs.description: the big holy tree of Kynareth that died

kbs.name: Eldergleam
kbs.description: the ancient parent tree of the Gildergreen

kbs.name: Nettlebane
kbs.description: a weapon that can cut the Eldergleam

plots: disciples of Kynareth used to travel far to hear the winds of Kynareth in the Gildergreen's branches

quest.title: The Blessings of Nature
quest.objective: restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
tasks: Make your way to Orphan Rock.
get Nettlebane
restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
quest.description:
This is the Gildergreen. It was planted as a seedling in the early years of Whiterun. Disciples of Kynareth could sense something holy in it, and traveled far to hear the winds of the goddess in its branches. Of course, not as many pilgrims these days. A big dead tree isn't very inspiring if you're coming to worship the divine of wind and rains. Kynareth gives life, and we need a living tree to be her symbol.
I've thought about restoring the Gildergreen... Trees like this never really die. They only slumber. I think if we had some of the sap from the parent tree, Eldergleam, we could wake up its child. But even if you could get to the Eldergleam, you couldn't tap it. Not with any normal metal. If you want to help, you'll need something to cut into it first.
Eldergleam is older than metal, from a time before men or elves. To even affect it, you have to tap into the old magic. You'll have to deal with the Hagravens. I've heard about a weapon they've made for sacrificing Kynareth's creations. It's called "Nettlebane." The hags terrify me, or I would have gone after it myself. It's held in a Hagraven nest called Orphan Rock

I'd like to redecorate my home. Stranger, could you do a man a favor? Obtain ten red banners and bring them to me. I have heard that you can craft banners from sticks and wool.

Someone has contracted us to kill Beitild. She separated from her husband several months ago. Now the two run competing mining operations in Dawnstar. I hear the mining business is extremely cutthroat. And those hours... they're murder.
Beitild's angry and desperate. A fighter.

kbs.name: Kolbjorn Barrow
kbs.description: an ancient tomb buried in ash in the northern ashlands of Solstheim

kbs.name: Mournhold
kbs.description: a large city on the mainland

plots: the ash storms fill up Kolbjorn Barrow faster than Ralis Sedarys can dig

quest.title: Unearthed
quest.objective: become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
tasks: give 1,000 gold to Ralis Sedarys so that he can hire some diggers from Raven Rock to dig up Kolbjorn Barrow
become Ralis Sedarys' business partner in his search for the Relics of Ahzidal in Kolbjorn Barrow
quest.description:
The name's Ralis. Ralis Sedarys, out of Mournhold.
I've got a financier waiting for me back on the mainland. Sent me here in the interests of obtaining some rare antiquities. The 'Relics of Ahzidal.' But this whole thing became a disaster right quick, let me tell you.
You come out to the northern ashlands, you don't expect things to go easy, you know? But this was something outside my particular expertise. When I first got to Kolbjorn, you couldn't even see it. Buried in the ash, like most other things on this blasted island. Dug out a pile of the stuff taller than me just to find the barrow. Who knows how much to reach the door. Excavating isn't exactly my specialty. Even if it was, the ash storms fill it in faster than you can dig.
Could you become my business partner? We can sort out the details of our little arrangement later, but for now, I'll manage the dig if you can manage the coin.
When you have 1,000 gold for me, I'll head back to Raven Rock and round up some diggers. Once we've got something worth looking at, I'll send word to you.

quest.description:
I'm a fletcher. Bows and arrows are my domain.
In fact, I've just crafted a special Bow I've dubbed the "Awesome Bow". I just need someone to test it out.
You could be just the right person for the job. Go, and kill 15 Creepers with the Awesome Bow. I friggin' hate those green suicide bombing monsters! I'll have 32 emeralds for you, as a tester's fee.

quest.title: The Rosethorn Cache
quest.objective: find Daravyn the Gray's hidden treasure
tasks: Go to Rosethorn Hall.
solve the riddle that takes you to the treasure
find Daravyn the Gray's hidden treasure
quest.description:
Long Forgotten Note
by Daravyn the Gray

My love,
I write this with trembling hands. The guards are after me, and I have nowhere else to turn. Soon they will be at the doors to Rosethorn Hall, and nothing will keep them from taking me away back to that horrible prison. I don't know how they found me; perhaps it was that traitor, Delgariun. Whoever told them I was hiding in your home must have known both of us very well. I know Delgariun has eyes for you, I know he's the one that framed me in the first place and had me sent to that dank hole in the Imperial City. He has to be the one. Beware of him, my love. He's treacherous and only wants you to get to the treasure. I didn't give it up to the guards, and I won't give it up to Delgariun. I've hidden the treasure within the walls of Rosethorn Hall. Remember the toy we played with as we ran through this place as children?
Remember the riddle we had for it? It was our secret code: "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."
The key to the treasure lies with the answer. Take care of it, my love. It is your ticket far from Delgariun. Do not fret, I've escaped once, I shall do so again. Soon we will be together, and the sun will shine upon us.
Daravyn the Gray

kbs.name: Stone of Barenziah, Stones of Barenziah

tasks: Make your way to Skyrim.

talk to Vex after collecting the 24 Stones of Barenziah
quest.description:
Been a while since I've seen one of those. What you've got there is a Stone of Barenziah. The stone was pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks.
I think there were twenty-four in all; supposedly, all of them are in Skyrim. Most people keep them as a curiosity. Some of the Guild members have tried to locate them over the years, but they haven't been successful... well, until now.
I only buy things I can turn around quickly for a profit. And no one wants those stones unless they have the whole set. Tell you what, if you find the rest of them, talk to me again. Otherwise, keep it and maybe it'll bring you luck.

kbs.name: Hill of Suicides
kbs.description: a nasty place where people who have committed suicide end up

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one Demented and other Manic

quest.title: A Serious Split
quest.objective: resolve the issue with duplicate citizens
tasks: kill the manic citizens of Split
resolve the issue with duplicate citizens
quest.description:
Talking wears me, Horkvir Bear-Arm, out.
My double is always working. It takes all my energy just watching him work. It's got to stop. It's a problem, all these doubles walking around. And it's tiresome. Didn't used to be like this.
Some blasted mage. Had a theory. They've always got theories. He thought there was a Manic and a Demented in each of us. So, what does he do? What else? Casts a spell. You can see how well that went. Two of each of us walking around this place. Nothing we can do about it, either. There's a law about that here. Been to the Hill of Suicides? Not a nice place. But you might be able to help.
Only one group can stick around. Either we Demented or those blasted Manics. It's the only way we'll find any peace. You get rid of those Manics. All of them. If you can take care of that for me, I'd make it worth your while..

Lady Narina Carvain, Countess of Bruma. Welcome.
I've been looking for just the right owner for a special home I have. It's a quaint little house conveniently located just off the main gate. I'll sell it to you for 10,000 gold.
I've had a look at the place myself, and it could use some furnishings inside. Quite barren in there I'm afraid. I'm fairly certain that Suurootan at Novaroma here in Bruma can acquire the things you'll need to make it look like home.

kbs.description: a tower atop untouched dungeons filled with riches

quest.description:
I'm Galken. Hey, how'd you like to be supping on fine venison and tippin' back the good stuff?
I've the key to wealth legendary if you're up for it. No doubt you've heard of the labyrinth at Durlag's Tower, eh? And how she's been pillaged so often that fat nobles go there for picnics? Well, the TOWER has, but BELOW are dungeons untouched! I've a token, a ward token to be sure, that gives entry to them.
'Tis yours if you'll but settle my tab so I can leave this fine place... with all my limbs intact.

kbs.name: Haelga
kbs.description: a devout female worshiper of Dibella

kbs.name: Dibella
kbs.description: the goddess of love and passion

kbs.name: Bolli, Hofgrir, Indaryn
kbs.description: the three men Haelga slept with

kbs.name: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella

plots: when Haelga sleeps with a man, Haelga gives the man a Mark of Dibella

quest.title: Caught Red Handed
quest.objective: help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
tasks: gather 3 Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn, and confront Haelga with the Marks of Dibella
help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
quest.description:
I hate Haelga! It's everything about her. She's disgusting. I think she takes her worship of Dibella a bit too seriously.
Do you know she's slept with three different men in the last month alone? What kind of a woman would do such a thing? Just for once, I'd like to see her squirm... to rub her nose in it.
Actually, there is a way to do this, but I don't think I could get away with doing it. She'd kill me if she found out. You see, I happen to know after she makes love, she gives her partner a token of her affection called a Mark of Dibella. If you confront her with three of the Marks of Dibella, she'd be so embarrassed... well, I don't know what she'd do!
Oh, this is going to be great! You need to get the Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn. Not sure how you're going to do that, but try your best. Then just confront Haelga with them and the rest works itself out.

kbs.description: an elven mage who was a guide to Balduran

quest.title: Returning Dradeel's Spellbook
quest.objective: destroy the lycanthropes' lair, and bring Dradeel's spellbook back to its owner
tasks: Reach Balduran's ship.

destroy the lycanthropes' lair, and bring Dradeel's spellbook back to its owner
quest.description:
I am Dradeel, mage and recent convert to the Church of Selûne.
I was the guide for Balduran's brave adventures to the ends of the world and beyond. The wolf-men are everywhere. The lycanthropes' lair is in Balduran's ship. My spellbook lies within. With it, I am a powerful mage. Without it, I am the pauper that stands before you. With my spellbook retrieved, I may be able to discover a way off of the island.
If you go to destroy the lycanthropes' lair, I would ask that you find my book.

quest.title: Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!
quest.objective: destroy the Dark Brotherhood

use "Silence, my brother." to enter the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary
destroy the Dark Brotherhood
quest.description:
The leader of the Dark Brotherhood? You mean that woman Astrid? Dead? And this is no jest? Ha! This is a stroke of good fortune. Long have I watched the Dark Brotherhood's movements... waiting for the time to strike. That time is now!
My agents have recently acquired the passphrase to their Sanctuary. It is, "Silence, my brother." Every assassin in that hole must be put down! You, my friend. You've slain their leader. This honor should be yours. Do this, and you will be rewarded most handsomely!

kbs.description: the player's teacher in magic at the College of Winterhold

kbs.name: College of Winterhold
kbs.description: a school for mages in Skyrim

kbs.name: Staff of Magnus
kbs.description: a mage's staff that can absorb a tremendous amount of power

plots: the player needs the Staff of Magnus to break through Ancano's dangerous magic

the player knows that the Staff of Magnus is in Labyrinthian: Savos Aren gave Mirabelle Ervine something from Labyrinthian before he died, Mirabelle Ervine gives the player this item and Savos Aren's amulet

quest.title: The Staff of Magnus
quest.objective: bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
tasks: Arrive at Labyrinthian.
find the Staff of Magnus
bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
quest.description:
You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.
I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
You know that the staff is in Labyrinthian? Are you... Are you sure? The staff is there? That can't be a coincidence. The Arch-Mage. Before... before he died. He... He gave me something just a little while ago. He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came. I think... I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him. Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think would do you the most good now. Take it, and get out of here.
Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us. If we can't stop this, what happens to the rest of Skyrim?

quest.title: Joseph's Wife
quest.objective: investigate Joseph's fate for his wife

investigate Joseph's fate for his wife
quest.description:
My husband is missing in the mines. All I know about the mines are that men keep on disappearing in their hellish depths.
My husband is one of the miners, but he hasn't been home for weeks. His name is Joseph, and he wears his wedding ring on his left hand. It's a greenstone ring.
Please, find him and tell me how he is doing!

quest.title: Baiting the Trap
quest.objective: get out of Xedilian
tasks: deal with the adventurers
get out of Xedilian
quest.description:
Welcome to Xedilian, I'm the dungeon caretaker, Kiliban Nyrandil.
Xedilian would normally have sent you back to the entrance when you stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber. Since you're up here, I can only surmise that adventurers are already entering the dungeon as we speak.
I'm afraid until the adventurers are dealt with, Xedilian will keep you here. Even I can't will its doors to open. To put it bluntly, you're stuck here for the moment. No disrespect intended.
The only thing we can do is let the adventurers complete a cycle through here. I'll be glad to help. I assume Sheogorath gave you the Manual. You can consult it for more information, or I can provide instructions.

quest.description:
I... my name is Wellyn. I just want... I just want my stuffed bear back...
It's my favorite bear, Littleman... The bad man who came into our house... he—he hurt me, and he took Littleman with everything else... *sob* I can never go to sleep without Littleman! The bad man has it at that inn in the slums. The Copper something. *sniff* He's in one of those bedrooms in the back! I think his name is "Llynis"...
I've... I've gone to him... *sob*... I've tried to tell him that I just want my bear, please, but he just gets too frightened of me. *sob* Oh, please get it from him!

You can't find them on Solstheim, but if you find yourself back in Skyrim, I wouldn't mind you bringing some juniper berries.

plots: Pate wants equipment
the player is a friend of Pate

quest.title: Deal of the Century
quest.objective: bring 2 blocks of diamond to Pate
tasks: Find your way to diamond veins deep in the ground.
obtain 2 blocks of diamond
bring 2 blocks of diamond to Pate
quest.description:
My friend, I've got a profitable deal for you today. As you know, I smith weapons from a variety of materials, including diamond.
Just so it happens, I'm running low on diamonds: soon I can't make any diamond swords for daring adventurers. I'm not skilled in adventuring; I can't brave the deep underground for diamond veins.
Yet, I have a whopping block of Netherite. You definitely don't see those every day! Here's the deal: bring me 2 blocks of diamond, and I'll give you my block of Netherite. A good deal for a good friend.

kbs.name: Fade
kbs.description: an immortal spirit who covets the remains of the living

plots: the player has summoned Fade: the player wants to enter Cacklespit's Realm

quest.title: Cacklespit's Realm
quest.objective: bring 4 skulls of famous warriors to Fade
tasks: find 4 skulls of famous warriors
bring 4 skulls of famous warriors to Fade
quest.description:
I am Fade - why have you summoned me?
Ah, you want to enter Cacklespit's hidden realm. Yes, I know the way - but I do not provide service without compensation.
I have very particular... appetites. The remains of the living are infused with a lingering residue of deeds past, which sustains me. Bring me the skulls of four warriors of renown, and I will take you where you wish to go. This battlefield is littered with the bones of great heroes. Your search should not be difficult.

kbs.name: Deor Woodcutter
kbs.description: a Skaal man in a bad mood

kbs.name: Baldor Iron-Shaper
kbs.description: a Skaal man, the only blacksmith in the Skaal village

plots: Baldor Iron-Shaper is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim
Deor Woodcutter saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them in the woods on the day Baldor Iron-Shaper disappeared: the elves went south and west

quest.title: A New Source of Stalhrim
quest.objective: find Baldor Iron-Shaper
tasks: search for any sign of Baldor
find Baldor Iron-Shaper
quest.description:
I am in no mood to talk, outsider. One of the Skaal has gone missing. It is Baldor Iron-Shaper. As our only smith, Baldor is very important to the village.
Baldor is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. It is an art we Skaal hold sacred. If someone wanted to make such weapons, they would have to get that knowledge from Baldor.
I did see something in the woods on the day he disappeared. I saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them. Hunters often visit our lands, so I thought little of it.
The elves went south and west. If your road takes you that way, perhaps you could search for any sign of Baldor. The Skaal would be grateful.

kbs.name: Forsaken Cave
kbs.description: a long forsaken cave to the west of Windhelm

kbs.name: Curalmil
kbs.description: a crafty, long-dead alchemist, and the creator of the White Phial

kbs.name: White Phial
kbs.description: a legendary bottle that will replenish whatever fluid is placed inside of it

plots: Nurelion's assistant won't let Nurelion get the White Phial himself
Nurelion gives the player the alchemical mixture that is needed to reach Curalmil's resting place

quest.title: The White Phial
quest.objective: retrieve the White Phial for Nurelion
tasks: Go to Forsaken Cave.
reach Curalmil's resting place
retrieve the White Phial for Nurelion
quest.description:
I've finally derived the location of the White Phial, but my doting busybody of an assistant won't let me get it.
It's buried with its maker, Curalmil, in Forsaken Cave, a long forsaken cave to the west of here. Curalmil was a crafty one, even in death. You would need the skills of a master alchemist to reach his resting place.
Luckily for you, I've already made the required mixture. Here, take it. Please... don't dally. I've wasted enough time arguing with my useless assistant here.

kbs.name: Salmon Steps
kbs.description: a nearby river rich in salmon

plots: Thomas wants comfort

quest.title: Catch of the Day
quest.objective: help Thomas gather fish for his village
tasks: Arrive at Salmon Steps.
catch 16 fish
help Thomas gather fish for his village
quest.description:
Traveler, I'm worried about my fellow villagers here in the village. I don't think that they eat enough nutritious, tasty fish.
Could you help me gather more? I simply can't catch enough fish for everyone, even if I'm a pro fisherman.
There is a river, Salmon Steps, bountiful in salmon near here. You could try your luck there, and catch 16 fish for me. I could pay you 32 shiny, green emeralds for the fish.

kbs.name: Crucible
kbs.description: a district of a big city

plots: Ahjazda is the only one who sees the approaching storm

quest.title: The Coming Storm
quest.objective: help Ahjazda prepare for the coming storm
tasks: bring the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and the Calming Pants to Ahjazda
help Ahjazda prepare for the coming storm
quest.description:
So much to gather, so little time. Perhaps you can help? You might help against the coming storm.
It's coming. I, Ahjazda, think I'm the only one who sees it, though. And I'm going to be ready. Oh, yes. I'll be ready. I've been stockpiling supplies. Things I'll need to ride it out... or survive when they come for me.
I've been gathering things for quite a while, but there are still a few I'm missing. Perhaps you'd bring them to me? I still need the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and, of course, the Calming Pants. Must have the Calming Pants. Bring these to me, and I will reward you well. Ahjazda has many, many things.
Let me teach you a special spell, Ahjazda's Paranoia, after you return with the items. It will affect all those around you. You might find it handy to cause confusion in your enemies. You know... when the time comes.

kbs.name: Heide
relations: an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet

kbs.name: an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet
kbs.description: an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet

kbs.name: Elder Guardian
kbs.description: [Enemy] one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish that can shoot laser, and make the player fatigued when the player is near them
relations: an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet

plots: Heide wants serenity
the player is an enemy of Heide

quest.title: The One That Got Away
quest.objective: recover Heide's fishing rod
tasks: Find your way to an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet.
find the Elder Guardian that swallowed Heide's fishing rod, and kill it
recover Heide's fishing rod
quest.description:
I just escaped with my life from a friggin' Elder Guardian, and now I run into you, my least favorite person in the whole world.
The damn Elder Guardian swallowed the hook, line, and sinker of my fishing rod while I was out in the sea fishing on my boat. It must have eaten the whole fishing rod after it slipped from my grip into the sea.
I shouldn't have gone fish so close to the ocean monument far south of this village. I just couldn't see the turquoise stones that make up the monument before it was too late. Who even built those dangerous underwater temples anyway?
I have a proposition for you: recover my fishing rod from the Elder Guardian, and I'll set you up with enough cooked salmon to last your lifetime. We might even become friends. First, you have to find the Elder Guardian, and kill it.
Elder Guardians are one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish. They can shoot laser, and make you fatigued when you get close to them.

kbs.name: Great Door
kbs.description: a door that leads to the Clockwork Core

plots: the Alchemist came through the Imperial Camp an hour ago: he went through the Great Door and sealed it behind him
the Great Door leads to the Clockwork Core

quest.title: Some Assembly Required
quest.objective: open the Great Door
tasks: Proceed to Scrapworks.
find a power source for the dwarven automaton
open the Great Door
quest.description:
I wish you had gotten here sooner! The Alchemist came through here about an hour ago. He laid waste to the camp and then went through the Great Door, there - sealed it shut behind him.
We believe that door leads to the Clockwork Core. We've been unable to open it ourselves, but we know how in theory. See that dwarven automaton? It's designed to open the door, but it's missing its Power Source. There should be one in the Scrapworks, but it was too dangerous for us to enter. Perhaps you will have more luck.

kbs.name: Mehrunes Dagon
kbs.description: the male prince of destruction, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Uriel Septim VII cannot go further
the player alone must stand against Mehrunes Dagon and his mortal servants: Mehrunes Dagon must not have the Amulet of Kings

quest.title: The Voice of the Emperor
quest.objective: find Uriel Septim VII's son and close shut the jaws of Oblivion
tasks: give the Amulet of Kings to Jauffre, and ask Jauffre about finding Uriel Septim VII's secret son
find Uriel Septim VII's son and close shut the jaws of Oblivion
quest.description:
I can go no further. You alone must stand against the Prince of Destruction and his mortal servants. He must not have the Amulet of Kings!
Take the Amulet. Give it to Jauffre. I have a secret son, and Jauffre alone knows where to find him.
Find my son, and close shut the jaws of Oblivion.

plots: wants protection
the player is a famous hero

quest.title: Guards! Guards! Guards!
quest.objective: build a watchhouse in River's End
tasks: find construction materials
build a watchhouse in River's End
quest.description:
River's End is a large village, yet we lack a watchhouse! We don't have a place to store away all troublemakers! They are free to roam along the law-abiding people...
Hero, you are an honorable person. Could you build us a watchhouse? You should gather up some construction materials first. Complete the watchhouse, and we'll give you an enchanted axe. May it help you bury your enemies!

kbs.name: Dennis' family gong
kbs.description: a gong that belonged to Dennis' mother

plots: Dennis is the leader of a mercenary band from Riatavin
Roger might have bought Dennis' family gong

quest.title: Recover Dennis' Mother's Gong
quest.objective: find Dennis' family gong
tasks: Find your way to the sewers below the city.
find Roger
find Dennis' family gong
quest.description:
I be Dennis... the leader of mercenary fellows out o' Riatavin.
Me gong was stolen. The gong belonged to my mother... it was her dowry and worth a great deal of coin. A damnable lout stole it before my gong lessons were even finished!
The lout sold it to a fence by the name of Roger not too long ago, I do think. He lives in the sewers below th' city, although I knows not exactly where. He might still have it.
Please find me family gong!

kbs.name: High Queen Freydis
kbs.description: a queen who ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, had a legendary sword

plots: the player asked Oengul War-Anvil whether he is the castle blacksmith
Oengul War-Anvil is working an a sword: the Jarl of Windhelm wants it to look like High Queen Freydis' sword

quest.title: The Queen's Sword
quest.objective: retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
tasks: Reach Cronvangr Cave.
find High Queen Freydis' sword
retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
quest.description:
Of course I am the castle blacksmith. What do I look like, a tavern wench? Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary. Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place, Cronvangr Cave.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.

plots: the player is Sheogorath's newest and only noble in the realm
a messenger told Sheogorath that Order has attacked Brellach and routed his soldiers

quest.title: The Helpless Army
quest.objective: free Brellach from Order
tasks: talk to the messenger
free Brellach from Order
quest.description:
There's a perfect job for you, my newest and only Noble in the realm!
A messenger told me that Order has attacked my army's stronghold at Brellach and routed my soldiers! If Order has truly entered my army's stronghold, things have taken a disturbing turn. It means Order has tried subterfuge... not its strong suit. Amazing! Perhaps things aren't going as poorly as I'd imagined.
You'll want to get all the details from the messenger. Unless you already have. You haven't, have you?

kbs.name: Sheogorath
kbs.description: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

kbs.name: New Sheoth
kbs.description: the capital city of Sheogorath's realm

kbs.name: Haskill
kbs.description: Sheogorath's Chamberlain who knows a lot

plots: Sheogorath gives the player summon Haskill spell for their previous services
the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia show the player what New Sheoth truly is
once the player understands what Sheogorath's Realm is, the player might understand why it's important to keep it intact

quest.title: Understanding Madness
quest.objective: meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
tasks: Reach Sheogorath's Palace.
seek out the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia
meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
quest.description:
I'm Sheogorath, Prince of Madness. And other things. I'm not talking about them. As you should know by now.
You've run a maze like a good little rat, but no cheese for you yet. Well, maybe a little. I've granted you a new spell - the ability to summon Haskill, my Chamberlain, to aid you in your travels. He knows a lot. More than he knows.
Now we're going to give you a taste of where you have found yourself. You're going to learn. Two halves, two rulers, two places within my palace. Meet and greet. Do what they will, so you know what they're about.
The Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia. Seek them out, and let them show you what New Sheoth is. You might be surprised. Once you understand what My Realm is, you might understand why it's important to keep it intact. And maybe you'll make some friends along the way. That's always nice!

kbs.name: Lord Taldimut
kbs.description: the player's old friend, who promised the player a a greater reward if the player came to visit him in Ossean Wastes

kbs.name: Celestial Armory
kbs.description: Lord Taldimut's armory that houses some of the finest weapons

kbs.name: Armory Portal
kbs.description: a hidden portal to the Celestial Armory

plots: Ezrohir have the Celestial Armory under siege

quest.title: The Key to Victory
quest.objective: help Lord Taldimut gather up weapons and armor from the Celestial Armory without Ezrohir noticing
tasks: Arrive at Celestial Armory.
use the Golden Gear to get inside the Celestial Armory, and activate the Armory Portal
help Lord Taldimut gather up weapons and armor from the Celestial Armory without Ezrohir noticing
quest.description:
It's good to see you again, my friend! I know that I promised you a greater reward, should you come to visit... but that was before I returned to the Ossean Wastes and found the Celestial Armory under siege by Ezrohir.
What if I give you your choice of artifacts from the Armory? The Celestial Armory houses some of the finest weapons in the world! You have but to use the Golden Gear to get inside, then activate the Armory Portal, which will allow us to gather up the weapons and armor safely... with the Ezrohir none the wiser!

kbs.name: Tut's Temple
kbs.description: an ancient desert pyramid filled with traps and treasure, a short way away from Desert Refuge

plots: Zed wants knowledge

quest.title: Ancient Artisanship
quest.objective: bring an ancient device to Zed
tasks: Head to Tut's Temple.
find the ancient device
bring an ancient device to Zed
quest.description:
Hello traveler. What brings you to Desert Refuge, this piece of civilization out in the scorching desert? Are you stocking up on supplies on your way to explore desert ruins?
If you are, I would like your help. I promise to pay you with something useful. The thing is, there's this ancient pyramid, Tut's Temple, a short way away from this village. It is said to be full of treasure! And some highly lethal traps that are too much to overcome for a meager researcher like me. There are also rumors that say that the ancients had useful devices lost to time. I'd love to get my hands on one, for science.
Please, go to Tut's Temple and find an ancient device! It may tell us about many lost crafts!

plots: Onmund traded Enthir his amulet, but now Onmund wants his amulet back

quest.title: Onmund's Request
quest.objective: help Onmund get his amulet from Enthir
tasks: talk to Enthir about Onmund's amulet
help Onmund get his amulet from Enthir
quest.description:
I need your help with something. Something private.
I may have entered into an... agreement with Enthir. He had something I needed, so I traded him something of mine.
It was a mistake, and now I want back what I gave him. It's an amulet that belonged to my family, and I never should've given it to Enthir. But he won't deal with me. Talk to him; see what it'll take to get my amulet back.

plots: Arnold wants reputation
the player is a famous hero

quest.title: Number One Armorer
quest.objective: bring 32 blocks of iron to Arnold
tasks: Travel to iron veins in the ground.
Head to a furnace somewhere.
Make your way to any crafting bench.
obtain iron ore
smelt iron ore into iron ingots
craft iron ingots into blocks of iron
bring 32 blocks of iron to Arnold
quest.description:
I want to become famous. Just not quite like you, hero. I seek to become the best armorer in the world. To do that, I need a lot of practice in hammering down pieces of armor.
Would you please bring me 32 blocks of iron? Those should help me become a better armorer in no time! First, you have to get iron ore from the many iron veins in the ground. Next, you'll want to smelt the ore into iron ingots in a furnace somewhere. Lastly, you ought to craft those iron ingots into blocks of iron on a crafting table.
Do all that, and I promise to outfit you in better armor than what you are wearing now!

kbs.name: Jensine
kbs.description: a merchant, and the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants

plots: trouble began when Thoronir opened his store selling all kinds of merchandise undercutting the competition: Thoronir refuses to join the Society of Concerned Merchants or discuss the matter

quest.title: Unfriendly Competition
quest.objective: find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing
tasks: investigate Thoronir's store to find out where he gets his inventory
find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing
quest.description:
I think you may be just the kind of person we're looking for. Perhaps you can assist us with a problem we're having here in the Market District.
I'm the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants. We formed this group a while back to keep a nice fair economic balance in town. Not every store is a member, but we're slowly trying to convince them to join. Everything was fine until Thoronir opened his shop nearby.
Selling all sorts of merchandise, Thoronir undercuts prices like you wouldn't believe. He doesn't always sell what we sell, but it is still a problem. People who buy tend to want to spend their money there. That leaves none for us. It's getting so bad, a few of us may have to close up shop. He outright refuses to join the Society or even discuss the matter. We are convinced he is up to no good.
What we need is for you to case his establishment, and figure out where he gets his inventory. Find some proof of his wrongdoing, and let us know. We cannot do it ourselves, as he recognizes all of us. The job pays a fair bounty in gold when he is brought to justice.

kbs.name: Hag's End
kbs.description: a ruin far to the northeast of Deepwood Redoubt

plots: the player came to Olava the Feeble for a reading

quest.title: Locate the Assassin of Old
quest.objective: go on an adventure
tasks: Travel to Hag's End.
find the final resting place of the assassin of old
go on an adventure
quest.description:
Come to Olava for a reading, did you? Hmph. Yes. Yes, I surely can give you a reading.
It's not something I do lightly, mind you, and it's not as specific as you might want. But yes. I will do this for you. Please, relax. Free your mind. Yes, that's it...
A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest... Through there is... Hag's End. The last resting place of an assassin of old. A dark brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
No... no, that is all. Now... now please. I find myself very weary all of sudden.
